text_section1.text: It was the strangest game a man ever set out to bag! --- How could a thing like this elude a hunter --- when it was dead?
With the right kind of transportation a man could get to dimension five! With the right weapon, he could bag some unusual game. I, Jim Blair, had both the transportation and the weapon --

When little Mark Stossel asked me to test-pilot the strange machine he'd built, I never realized the thrills that lay in store for me. Dimension five was alive with game -- and hunting was my favorite sport --

text_section2.text: I don't know what this thing is, but it sure gives a man a fight!

text_section1.text: Max had given me what he called a vibration rifle. It was another of his inventions, and it sure did the trick against these strange animals in dimension five --

text_section2.text: I guess I'd better head for the machine before I get lost in this place!

text_section1.text: Then I saw it -- this amazing little whatsit. It looked tough and mean and dangerously fast!

text_section2.text: Oh - oh! This baby is ready to spring!

text_section1.text: I caught that baby in mid-leap. The vibrations from my rifle did a quick, neat job --
I examined the fantastic creature. For it's small size and weight, it could have handled anything from a lion to an elephant. I was glad the rifle worked --

text_section2.text: Wow! If that thing had ever gotten to me first --

text_section1.text: I then located the `egg', a most suitable name for Max's dimension hopping machine. And I gingerly hopped back to dimension 3!
It took seconds to cross a limitless gulf of time and space --
Then I was back again in Max's basement laboratory --

text_section2.text: She works fine, Max. Dimension five is an exciting place!

text_section3.text: That's wonderful, Jim! I - I don't know how I can repay you for making this test!

text_section1.text: It was the greatest experience of my life! The money we agreed upon will cover the risks!

text_section2.text: It isn't much, Jim -- I'm not a rich man, but I cannot tell you how grateful I am for your help!

text_section1.text: Well, this won't make me a millionaire, but I'll have a wealth of stories to tell at the hunter's club!

text_section2.text: I imagine you'll be the most popular member there!

text_section1.text: Max was right. At the club, I was the center of attention when I began recounting my adventures in dimension five --

text_section2.text: Surely, you can't ask us to believe all this, Jim!

text_section1.text: These strange animals you describe -- they couldn't possibly exist! You must be ribbing us!

text_section2.text: Oh, no! They exist all right -- but in a place only I can get to!

text_section1.text: Five foot insects with feathers and blue tails -- ha ha ha ha!!

text_section2.text: Transparent things with peanut brains and yards of nerves -- ha ha ha ha!

text_section1.text: Of course they laughed. I expected that, but no one could fabricate the minute details I'd given them. They'd realize it sooner or later. Carl Neuberg was the only man who didn't laugh --

text_section2.text: What would you say, Jim. If I made it worth your while to prove your claims?

text_section3.text: I'm always willing to listen to a millionaire sportman, Mister Neuberg!

text_section1.text: That last animal -- the one that sprang at you. If you could bring one back --- I'll pay you $200,000 for it -- it's worth it to me!
It's a deal, sir! I can have a trophy for you inside of an hour!

text_section2.text: I'll give you twenty four! I'm leaving for Europe tomorrow evening!

text_section1.text: It was more money than I ever hoped to accumulate. All I had to do was pick up that animal at the spot where I'd left it. I ran all the way to Max's laboratory --

text_section3.text: Thanks for letting me borrow the `egg', Max -- I'll be right back!

text_section1.text: In whirling seconds, I was back in the lush jungles of dimension five --
This is the trail I took. There's only a half mile to cover --
When I finally came to the spot, my triumph turned to ashes. I stared dumbfounded, realizing that I would never collect that two hundred thousand dollars!
The thing was there as I'd left it. -- But it was mountainous in size. Something in its body structure had caused it to grow after death!

text_section2.text: It - it's too big -- too big to take back with me!
